lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The steady rise of sterling, the currency of one of Ireland's main trading partners, has been a boost to Irish exporters with the country recording a 31 mln punt trade surplus in February, the 10th surplus in a row.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But in today's climate of economic austerity, few politicians would risk returning to the polls so soon and Haughey could cling to power for at least another two years if he brings in a belt-tightening budget next week, political commentators say.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: H.J. Heinz chairman Tony O'Reilly, one of the most successful Irishmen in international business, stressed the need for a frontal attack on the national debt, arguing "many of our children have lost faith in the future."
